Iuran BPJS Kesehatan Naik Bebani Anggaran Pemkab Rembang
05 Nov 2019, 06:32 by Usman Hadi


BPJS Kesehatan/Foto: Pradita Utama

Rembang - Iuran BPJS Kesehatan telah dipastikan akan naik 100% per 1 Januari 2020. Hal ini dianggap beban tersendiri bagi Pemerintah Kabupaten Rembang. Sekretaris Daerah Kabupaten Rembang, Subakti menyebut, kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan membuat alokasi APBD terbebani. Sebab, iuran BPJS bagi warga kurang mampu adalah tanggung jawab Pemerintah. "Jelas membebani, namanya saja naik. Kemarin dengan kenaikan 100 persen artinya anggaran jadi 2 kali lipat," kata Subakti saat ditemui detikcom, Selasa (5/11/19).Subakti menjelaskan, saat ini peserta BPJS kelas 3 yang menjadi penerima bantuan iuran (PBI) APBD Pemerintah Kabupaten sebanyak 54.969 warga. Selama ini, Pemkab mengalokasikan anggaran hingga Rp 13 miliar per tahun. Jika iuran BPJS naik hingga 100 persen, praktis tanggungan Pemkab juga naik sesuai dengan iuran yang telah ditetapkan. "Kemarin PBI APBD Pemkab sebelum ada kenaikan senilai Rp 13 Milyar, itu per tahun. Kemarin dengan kenaikan 100 persen artinya 2 kali lipat, berarti harus ada Rp 26 miliar sampai Rp 27 miliar yang harus di back up Pemkab," jelasnya. Sementara Pemkab Rembang sendiri, disebut Subakti baru mengusulkan anggaran dana PBI senilai Rp 10,4 miliar. Sehingga masih ada kekurangan anggan sedikitnya Rp 16 miliar. Atas dasar itulah, Subakti menyebut akan melakukan verifikasi ulang kepesertaan BPJS yang iurannya masih ditanggung oleh PBI APBD Pemkab. "Kita harus selektif lagi, dari 54 ribu peserta itu, apakah harus kita cover semua, ataukah kita bisa verifikasi lagi masihkah tepat penerimanya atau bukan. Potensi pengurangan peserta tetap ada, namun kita berusaha semaksimal mungkin untuk back up sesuai dengan yang telah ada saat ini," papar Subakti. Selain melakukan verifikasi ulang, Subakti mengaku juga akan melakukan usulan penambahan alokasi dana PBI Pemkab Rembang oleh Pemerintah Pusat. "Kemudian kami juga usulkan PBI Pemkab ini ke pusat, kita usulkan karena ssuai Undang-undag, untuk PBI BPJS ini bagi warga yang kurang mampu ditanggung Pemerintah. Nnti kita usulkan supaya minimal diback up oleh Pemerintah Pusat," pungkasnya. Simak Video "Keanggotaan BPJS Kesehatan 200 Lebih Ribu Warga Dinonaktifkan!"[Gambas:Video 20detik](hns/hns)

BPJS Health Contributions Increase Burden of Rembang Regency Budget
05 Nov 2019, 06:32 by Usman Hadi


BPJS Health / Photo: Pradita Utama

Rembang - BPJS Health contributions are certain to increase by 100% as of 1 January 2020. This is considered a separate burden for the Government of Rembang Regency. The Regional Secretary of Rembang Regency, Subakti said, the increase in BPJS Health contributions made the budget allocation burdened. Because, BPJS contributions for disadvantaged citizens are the responsibility of the Government. "Obviously burdening, the name just went up. Yesterday with a 100 percent increase means the budget has doubled," Subakti said when met with AFP on Tuesday (11/5/19). Subakti explained, currently BPJS class 3 participants who are recipients of contribution assistance (PBI) District Government APBD totaling 54,969 residents. So far, the Regency Government has allocated a budget of up to Rp 13 billion per year. If BPJS contributions go up to 100 percent, then the responsibility of the district government will also increase according to the stipulated fees. "Yesterday the PBI APBD of the Regency Government before there was an increase of Rp 13 billion, per year. Yesterday with a 100 percent increase means that it doubled, meaning there must be Rp 26 billion to Rp 27 billion, which must be backed up by the Regency Government," he explained. While the Rembang Regency Government itself, called Subakti, has just proposed a PBI fund budget of Rp. 10.4 billion. So there is still a lack of budget of at least Rp 16 billion. Based on that, Subakti said that he would re-verify BPJS membership whose contributions were still borne by the PBI APBD of the Regency Government. "We have to be selective again, out of the 54 thousand participants, do we have to cover everything, or can we verify again whether or not the recipient is still right. The potential for reducing participants is still there, but we are trying our best to back up in accordance with what is currently available. , "said Subakti. In addition to re-verification, Subakti claimed that he would also make a proposal to increase the allocation of PBI funds for the Rembang Regency Government by the Central Government. "Then we also propose this PBI to the central government, we propose it because of the Law, for the BPI PBI for citizens who are less able to be borne by the Government. We suggest that at least be backed up by the Central Government," he concluded. Check out the video "Membership of BPJS Health 200 Thousand Citizens Disabled!" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (hns / hns)
